title: The story behind the Rupee symbol: how it came into existence?
content: After extensive research, Udaya Kumar Dharmalingam combined the Devanagari ‘Ra’ for rupiah and the Roman ‘R’ for rupees to create the rupee (₹) symbol, giving it a distinctly Indian yet universal identity

title: In Karnataka, efforts on to combat the challenge of a hidden disability in newborns: hearing impairment
content: With the launch of the Newborn Hearing Screening programme by the Mysuru-based All India Institute of Speech and Hearing placing emphasis on early identification of hearing loss in newborns, nearly 6,000 are screened almost every month to detect hearing loss issues among the infants

title: Campaign against drugs: Battle for Andhra’s future
content: The government is planning to launch an aggressive campaign in schools and colleges to curb the menace of substance abuse; anti-drug clubs on all campuses and an army of mental health counsellors will spearhead the initiative, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Kolkata’s Jadavpur University loses Institute of Eminence status
content: It comes as the university remains embroiled in protests amidst rising demands for a student union election

title: The price of pet care in Hyderabad
content: Pet healthcare in Hyderabad is split between affordable but limited government hospitals and costly private clinics offering advanced care. The industry also suffers from weak regulation, inflated pricing and inconsistent veterinary expertise. Siddharth Kumar Singh explores the need for expanded government services, standardised pricing and stricter oversight to bridge this gap and make pet care more accessible

title: How can India meet its rising power demand?
content: Besides economic growth and urbanisation, climate change-induced heat stress is one of the key factors driving electricity demand. Episodes of power shortages in the last two years amid rapid growth in demand pose an important question. How should India act and plan to meet its rising energy demand reliably and cost-effectively?

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: CBI probing ‘role’ of public servants

title: No longer just a problem of the elderly, kidney disease is affecting young Indians too, say experts
content: Maintaining an ideal body weight, consuming a balanced diet and ensuring six to eight hours of sleep are all crucial steps towards ensuring kidney health; despite the increasing prevalence of kidney issues among young Indians, awareness remains low, say doctors

title: Haryana civic polls: Congress put up a half-hearted fight, BJP went all out
content: In the results declared on March 12, the BJP came out on top, winning mayoral elections in nine out of 10 municipal corporations.

title: Raising the rusty dust of red soil

title: Swanky new bus terminus to be constructed on 3.5 acres in Sholinghur at a cost of ₹20 cr.
content: The new spacious terminus will have a waiting hall for commuters, bus bays, a commercial complex, parking lots, a public announcement system, digital time display boards, a time-keeper’s office, water taps, toilets and ramps for people with disabilities.

title: Lawrence Super Bowl jab sparks spat with Parsons
content: DeMarcus Lawrence told a Seattle blogger Thursday that he was "not going to win a Super Bowl" in Dallas, a comment that led Cowboys star Micah Parsons to respond: "This what rejection and envy look like! This some clown s---!"

title: Curry hits 4,000 3s: 'Beyond my wildest dreams'
content: Stephen Curry became the first player to reach 4,000 3-pointers made in a career, extending his record to the milestone number Thursday night against the Kings.

title: Sources: George, doctors mulling star's injuries
content: 76ers forward Paul George is consulting with doctors this week on treatment options for his groin and knee injuries, including a possible procedure, sources told ESPN.

title: Darnold to apply lessons from disastrous '24 finish
content: New Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold is hoping to apply the lessons he learned from the disappointing end to his 2024 season, when he unraveled in two straight losses.

title: Texas' potential bid adds to 'historic' SEC season
content: Texas, the No. 13 seed in the SEC tournament which is on the bubble for the NCAA tournament, beat old foe Texas A&M in double overtime to reach the quarterfinals.

title: UK's Oweh beats buzzer, burns ex-team OU again
content: Otega Oweh hit the winning shot against his former school again, sinking a baseline jumper with 0.5 left to lift Kentucky past Oklahoma 85-84 in the SEC tournament.

title: Messi scores on return as Miami wins in Jamaica
content: Lionel Messi scored on his return to action as Inter Miami triumphed 2-0 in Jamaica over Cavalier FC on Thursday to qualify for the quarterfinals of the Concacaf Champions Cup.

content: Brentford captain Christian Nørgaard has said he feared becoming addicted to sleeping pills after taking the medication to prepare for away games.

content: United States defender Naomi Girma will miss Chelsea's League Cup final against Manchester City at Wembley Stadium on Sunday through injury, Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has confirmed.

content: The couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by R&B singer Ciara, who is married to Metcalf's former Seahawks teammate Russell Wilson.

content: A road accident in the Karelibag area of Gujarat's Vadodara has left one dead and several others injured after an allegedly drunk driver crashed his car into multiple vehicles late on Thursday night.

title: "As Soon As Train Stopped...": Hijacked Pak Train Driver Recalls Executions
content: Some hostages crouched on the floor for as long as 27 hours, remaining motionless, while some could only gasp in shock as armed rebels entered the train and began executing passengers.

title: How Broken Mercedes Parts Helped Cops Trace Dehradun Hit-And-Run Suspect
content: Dehradun Police used camera footage and broken car parts to track down the luxury SUV that was involved in a deadly hit-and-run incident in the city on Wednesday.

title: 'Due To Hindi Row, Delimitation...': Tamil Minister On Liquor Corruption Claims
content: Tamil Nadu Excise Minister Senthil Balaji on Friday strongly denied Enforcement Directorate claims of a possible fraud of Rs 1,000 crore in operations of the TASMAC, the state-run liquor sales agency.

title: Tamil Nadu Replaces Rupee Symbol Designed By Tamilian. How He Reacted
content: The designer of the rupee symbol has reacted to the controversy over the Tamil Nadu government replacing the sign with the Tamil letter "Ru" in promotional material for the state budget.

title: "A Green Card Holder Doesn't...": JD Vance Triggers New Immigration Debate
content: After US President Donald Trump's proposed 'gold card' initiative, which would create a new immigration pathway for wealthy foreigners, Vice President JD Vance's latest remarks on the rights of green card holders have triggered a fresh debate.

title: Brigadier Faces Case After Colonel's Wife Alleges Sex Abuse In Shillong
content: An Army Brigadier has been accused of sexual harassment by a junior officer's wife in Meghalaya capital Shillong. Meghalaya Police have registered a case, but no arrest has been made yet. An official response from the Indian Army is awaited.

title: Rupee Symbol, Replaced By Tamil Nadu, Was Designed By A Tamilian
content: D Udaya Kumar, currently working as a professor at IIT Guwahati, designed the Indian rupee symbol in 2010.

content: Jasprit Bumrah, who took the Player of the Series award in Australia for his 32 scalps, was subsequently ruled out of Indias Champions Trophy winning campaign

title: US Influencer Leaves Australia After Outrage Over Baby Wombat Video
content: In a now-deleted video, Sam Jones, an American influencer, was seen grabbing a baby wombat and carrying it away from his mother.

title: Truck Collides With Mumbai-Amravati Train, Passengers Safe
content: The crash reportedly damaged the railway infrastructure, including overhead electric wires. This disrupted the railway traffic briefly, which was restored around 8:50 am.

title: "Global Terrorism Epicentre": India Rips Into Pak Over Train Hijack Remark
content: India has rejected Pakistan's allegations that New Delhi is behind the violence in the neighbouring country where the latest in a series of bloodshed is a train hijacking by the Baloch rebels.

title: Innova Driver Loses Control, Rams Lorry, Then Hits Biker. 5 Injured
content: According to the Sub Inspector of Hanumakonda police station, a case has been registered in connection with the accident.

title: "Eye-Wash...": BJP Slams Tamil Nadu Budget, Its 4 MLAs And AIADMK Walk Out
content: The BJP's four Tamil Nadu MLAs walked out of the Assembly Friday, as the budget was being read out, to protest the currency symbol swap and allegations of corruption in TASMAC, the state-run liquor sales agency.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: VTU offers minor degree in Innovation and Entrepreneurship to augment employability and skills of engineering students
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: 'Distilleries siphoned off funds’: ED claims Rs 1,000cr booze scam in Tamil Nadu
content: Distilleries in Tamil Nadu allegedly siphoned off Rs 1,000 crore in collaboration with bottle-making companies through inflated expenses and bogus purchases, as revealed by ED. The funds were paid to Tasmac officials as kickbacks to secure more supply orders and manipulate tenders, leading to high profits.

title: 'Mistook us for dead': Pakistan train driver recalls 36-hour terror siege
content: The driver of Jaffar Express recounted the terror when BLA militants attacked the train, killing 21 civilians and 4 soldiers. The militants exploded a bomb under the engine, causing a derailment. The Pakistani military rescued 340 passengers after a two-day standoff, claiming 33 attackers were killed. The BLA disputed this, alleging they still hold hostages.

title: Metro expansions, new airport: Key takeaways from Tamil Nadu Budget
content: The Tamil Nadu government presented the 2025-26 budget with key welfare initiatives, including fare-free bus travel for women and monthly financial support. Amid the budget session, AIADMK protested over corruption allegations. Significant funds were allocated for housing, education, and new infrastructure projects.

title: Day after wedding, woman strangled to death by family for marrying man she loved
content: A woman named Neha in Greater Noida was allegedly strangled to death by her father and brother for marrying someone from a different caste. They cremated her body swiftly. Neha's husband, Suraj, alerted the police after learning about her death. The father and brother were arrested following the confession. An FIR has been registered for murder.

title: Class 5 student guarding crop with dad mistaken for thief, shot dead
content: In Babupur village, UP's Shahjahanpur, a class 5 student was fatally shot by a villager, Veerpal, and his son, Akash, after they mistook him for a thief while he was guarding his family's crop field. The incident occurred as the boy delivered dinner to his father. Both accused have been arrested and charged with murder.

title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, emphasized at TiECon Mumbai that many so-called AI systems in India are merely traditional programming. He stressed the importance of genuine AI, which relies on machine learning and deep learning. Murthy acknowledged AI's potential for job displacement but highlighted its economic benefits.

title: 75+ Holi messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Holi 2025, the festival of colors, marks the arrival of spring and the triumph of good over evil. People globally exchange heartfelt messages, wishes, and greetings, spreading happiness and positivity among friends, family, and loved ones. Celebrate the spirit of togetherness with joy and vibrant colors.

title: Man paraded naked, beaten up over affair in Gujarat
content: In Sabarkantha district, a man was abducted, beaten, and paraded naked by the husband and relatives of a woman he allegedly had an affair with. The incident occurred on March 11 in Chadasana village. The police have arrested seven people. The victim was forced to apologize in writing and his mobile was stolen.

title: 'Kamaal hai India ...': Anupam Mittal on Temasek's 10% stake in Haldiram
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal reacted to Temasek’s acquisition of a 9-10% stake in Haldiram's, valuing it at nearly $10 billion. This deal marks significant foreign investment in India's FMCG sector, with Temasek aiming to expand its footprint in the rapidly growing market.

title: Silent retreat, loud speculations: Is Kejriwal gearing up for Punjab elections?
content: Arvind Kejriwal’s Vipassana retreat in Punjab may signal a strategic shift for AAP, potentially involving party reshuffles ahead of the 2027 Punjab Assembly elections. While some speculate on internal meetings, AAP dismisses these as opposition rumors without substantiated development agendas.

title: 'Shami is a world-class player for a reason': Young Aussie rookie in awe of India pacer
content: Australia’s young all-rounder, Cooper Connolly, had a memorable ICC Champions Trophy semi-final debut against India. Despite an early dismissal by Mohammed Shami and dropping a catch, Connolly took Rohit Sharma's wicket, marking a significant achievement. Reflecting on the experience, he remains optimistic and eager to seize more opportunities at the international level.

title: Elon Musk shares Barack Obama’s old 'OMG video' on 'stupid spending’
content: Elon Musk shared an old video of Barack Obama, where the former president discusses reducing government waste and unnecessary spending. In the video, Obama highlights the importance of eliminating pointless expenses and mentions specific examples, stressing the need for efficient budget management.

title: 'My identity was erased': How Telangana man ended up in Myanmar cybercrime den
content: Telangana police, led by the Cyber Security Bureau, have registered nine FIRs against agents involved in trafficking individuals into Myanmar's cybercrime hubs. The crackdown follows the return of 24 victims and focuses on deceptive recruitment and coercion tactics used via social media. Further cases and identifications are underway.

content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: 'There was no doubt': Australia spinner after clearing bowling action test
content: Australian spinner Matthew Kuhnemann has been cleared to bowl after his action was questioned post-Sri Lanka tour. His 16-wicket haul led Australia to a 2-0 win. Kuhnemann was confident about his action and his experience. Despite missing one domestic game, he used the break to recover. Now, he's eyeing a spot on the West Indies tour.

title: POCSO case: Karnataka HC grants interim relief to former CM BS Yediyurappa
content: Karnataka High Court granted B.S. Yediyurappa interim relief by staying the summons in a POCSO Act case, requiring his appearance on March 15. The court emphasized a comprehensive investigation and quashing the charge sheet. Yediyurappa faces allegations of inappropriate touching and harassment but denies all charges, citing political motivations and readiness to face legal proceedings.

title: Watch: Video of New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon playing holi goes viral
content: A video of New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon celebrating Holi at ISKCON Auckland has resurfaced online. Luxon, set to visit India from March 16-20, aims to enhance trade and investment ties. He will meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu, and other leaders, emphasizing his admiration for India.

title: 'Another round': 23-yr old rams car into 3 vehicles, kills woman, injures 8 others
content: A 23-year-old law student, Rakshit Chaurasia, allegedly in a drunken state, hit three vehicles, injuring eight and killing one in Vadodara. Chaurasia was driving while his friend Meet Chauhan owned the car. Chaurasia and Chauhan face charges, including culpable homicide. The deceased woman is identified as Hemali Patel, with her husband critically injured.

title: 'We'll see some get deported': What US VP said about green card holders
content: US Vice President JD Vance addressed key issues including the deportation of green card holders, immigration enforcement, and border security on 'The Ingraham Angle.' He discussed the administration's efforts to reduce illegal migration, strengthen the economy, and implement 'America first' trade policies. Vance also highlighted the administration's commitment to tackling national security threats posed by non-citizens.

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: Accused Tarun Raju sent to 15-day judicial custody
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao was arrested for allegedly smuggling over 14 kg of gold after traveling to Dubai four times within 15 days. Her associate, Tarun Raju, was remanded to 15 days of judicial custody for his role in facilitating the purchase of the gold.

title: 3 dead after fire broke out at Rajkot's Atlantis building
content: A fire at the Atlantis Building in Rajkot, Gujarat, killed three people and injured one. Emergency services quickly responded and evacuated all residents. The fire has been controlled, and the injured person is receiving medical treatment. The names of the deceased have not yet been released, and further details are expected soon.

title: Chess Champion D Gukesh shaves head at Tirumala Temple- know tradition
content: Following his World Chess Championship victory, D Gukesh visits the Tirumala Temple in Andhra Pradesh, shaving his head to seek blessings. This traditional act signifies devotion and humility. Gukesh remains focused on upcoming tournaments in 2025, aiming for continuous improvement. His spiritual gesture has garnered appreciation online, with many praising his adherence to tradition.

title: Bihar cop dies as villagers attack police team, free arrested criminal
content: A Bihar assistant subinspector, Rajiv Ranjan Mall, died after a mob attacked a police team in Araria while they were apprehending notorious criminal Anmol Yadav at a wedding. Mall collapsed during the attack and was pronounced dead at the hospital. Six supporters of Anmol were arrested, but he remains untraced.

title: After ‘even God can’t fix Bengaluru traffic’ remark, DK rolls out solutions
content: Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has outlined an ambitious strategy to tackle Bengaluru's severe traffic congestion, including double-decker flyovers, tunnel roads, and elevated corridors. Key projects like the Peripheral Ring Road remain pending, while a substantial budget has been allocated for road improvements. Past infrastructural decisions are blamed for current woes, with new funding being secured to accelerate developments.

title: High-speed car kills 2 cops, civilian at police check post in Chandigarh
content: Two police officers and a civilian died when a speeding Volkswagen Polo crashed into them at a police check post in Chandigarh during Holi celebrations. The car driver and his friends were also injured, and liquor bottles were found in their vehicle. Senior police officials visited the scene to investigate.

title: Two Japanese tourists detained for taking ‘indecent’ photos at Great Wall of China
content: Two Japanese tourists were detained in China for two weeks for taking inappropriate photos at the Great Wall, with a man exposing his buttocks while a woman took pictures. After their detention, they were deported back to Japan, sparking outrage in China and leading to significant backlash on social media.

title: 'Allow agencies to intercept calls': Centre's conditions for India entry by Starlink
content: The Central Government has requested Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite venture, to establish a control centre in India. This measure will enable the suspension or shutdown of communications services in sensitive areas when needed to maintain law and order. Additionally, call interceptions by law enforcement agencies must be facilitated. Starlink is working with Reliance Jio and Airtel for network enhancements.

title: 'Don't remove my body': Tragic reasons behind award-winning farmer’s suicide
content: Young farmer awardee Kailash Arjun Nagare dies by suicide after consuming poison, citing government inaction on irrigation water demands. His death stirs massive unrest among local farmers, leading to protests and demands for accountability from the administration.

title: How broken Mercedes logo, CCTV tech helped crack Dehradun accident case
content: In Dehradun, police identified a hit-and-run vehicle by finding a broken Mercedes logo and using CCTV footage. The car, registered in Chandigarh, led them to nine potential matches. Further investigation and service records confirmed the culprit vehicle, ultimately tracing it back to the accused, Vansh Katyal, through his brother-in-law who owned the car.

title: Ranya Rao case: What blank ‘accused column’ in CBI FIR means for netas & babus
content: CBI has filed an FIR in Delhi regarding a gold-smuggling case allegedly involving actor Ranya Rao, without naming any specific individuals but identifying "unknown public servants" and "unknown private persons" as suspects. This step has intensified the investigation, potentially uncovering deep-rooted corruption within government circles.

title: Train collides with truck at closed level crossing in Maharashtra's Jalgaon
content: An Amravati-bound train collided with a truck illegally crossing closed railway tracks in Jalgaon, Maharashtra. No injuries were reported, but the collision disrupted the schedules of five trains, including the Mumbai-Amravati Express. The incident caused significant damage to railway infrastructure. Repair work is underway, and legal action may be taken against the truck driver.

title: Director Ayan Mukerji’s father, , veteran actor Deb Mukherjee, passes away
content: Veteran actor Deb Mukherjee, father of director Ayan Mukerji, passed away at 83. Known for films like 'Abhinetri' and 'Kaminey,' he had been hospitalized and died on March 14. Mukherjee's familial ties include actresses Kajol and Rani Mukerji. His contributions to Indian cinema and connection to Bollywood's Mukherjee-Samarth family are notable.

title: Axar Patel named Delhi Capitals captain for IPL 2025
content: Axar Patel has been named the new captain of Delhi Capitals for the upcoming IPL season. The experienced all-rounder, who has played 150 IPL matches, replaces Rishabh Pant. Delhi Capitals are the last team to announce their captain, with KL Rahul among the key players expected to support Axar’s leadership going into the 2025 season.

title: 'World knows where terror epicenter lies': India slams Pak’s train hijack allegation
content: India has strongly rejected Pakistan's allegations of involvement in the Balochistan train hijacking, pointing out Pakistan's issues with internal terrorism. Accusations emerged after the Balochistan Liberation Army seized the Jaffar Express, resulting in 58 deaths. Afghanistan also denied Pakistan's claims, urging Islamabad to address its own security challenges.

title: 'Have enough of our own ... ': Putin acknowledges Trump, PM Modi’s role in Ukraine talks
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed gratitude to leaders including India's PM Modi and US President Trump for their efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Putin agreed to a ceasefire if it leads to long-term peace, appreciating international support for peaceful resolution. PM Modi emphasized India's active role and reiterated the importance of negotiation over warfare.

title: 'Will deepen the colours of unity': PM Modi extends Holi wishes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, President Draupadi Murmu, Union home minister Amit Shah, and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi extended their Holi greetings, emphasizing themes of unity, harmony, progress, and prosperity. The leaders highlighted the significance of Holi in deepening bonds among citizens and celebrating India's cultural heritage, infusing joy, and bringing new enthusiasm into everyone's lives.

title: Faecal level in Yamuna 50 lakh, norm is 500
content: Yamuna's water quality has significantly deteriorated, with a marked increase in faecal coliform levels. The decline is attributed to substantial sewage discharge and inadequate functioning of sewage treatment plants (STPs). Key locations show dangerously high levels of pollution, exceeding safety limits.

title: 'Pending rent, no job, murder of partner': Woman 'kills' daughters, then herself
content: A 42-year-old woman and her two daughters were found dead from suspected poisoning in their Delhi flat, likely due to financial distress. The mother had previously been jailed for murder, and the family faced ongoing economic hardships. Neighbours described them as reclusive and seldom interacted.

title: Israel accused of sexual violence in Gaza war, Netanyahu calls report 'circus'
content: UN experts have accused Israel of committing sexual violence in Gaza, targeting hospitals and civilians, disproportionately affecting women and children. Israel rejects the UN's findings, labeling them biased. The investigation's results could be used in international legal cases, including at the International Criminal Court, which has already issued arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders.

title: Trump again suggests US could annex Greenland, hints at Nato’s role
content: US President Donald Trump suggested that the United States may eventually annex Greenland, highlighting its importance for international security. His comments came amid Greenland's parliamentary elections, where the Demokraatit Party, which opposes Trump's proposal, secured an unexpected victory.

title: Devotees accuse Mangaluru textile shop of supplying used saris to temple
content: Devotees at Sri Kshetra Gejjegiri in Puttur protested after a textile showroom in Mangaluru supplied used and damaged saris for their annual festival. The temple distributed these saris to women devotees as part of a ritual. The shop owner promised to replace the defective saris, attributing the issue to a factory in Surat.

title: Watch: A look inside ex-Andhra CM Jagan Reddy’s lavish sea-facing mansion
content: A mansion built for former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy in Visakhapatnam is facing scrutiny for its opulent design and high costs. Once intended as a camp office, the project has evolved through various stages, now sparking a debate on its usage and the ethics of public spending. The extravagance compares to Arvind Kejriwal's controversial residence renovation.

title: 'Lured to Punjab': GRP takes 18 off train to stop their ‘conversion’
content: Madhya Pradesh government railway police detained 18 passengers from the Patalkot Express for allegedly being lured into converting to Christianity with promises of financial rewards and opportunities abroad. The detentions followed a tip-off from Bajrang Dal officials and a subsequent coordinated operation.

title: Quitting alcohol increases bad cholesterol level, finds new study
content: A 10-year study published in JAMA Network Open reveals that individuals in Japan who quit alcohol experienced higher levels of LDL or 'bad' cholesterol and lower levels of HDL or 'good' cholesterol, compared to those who continued drinking. Researchers suggest monitoring lipid profile changes for effective cardiovascular disease risk management, while experts caution about the study's methodology.

title: Watch: GOP town hall sees heated exchange crowd and Rep. Chuck Edward
content: US Rep. Chuck Edwards faced a confrontational crowd in Asheville, North Carolina, with attendees protesting Trump administration policies and initiatives. Despite interruptions, Edwards discussed hurricane recovery efforts, government reductions, and support for Ukraine, while maintaining support for Trump and addressing concerns about Elon Musk's role in government security.

title: Denzel Washington speaks to Colorado football
content: the Colorado Buffaloes received words of wisdom from legendary actor and director Denzel Washington . "when you pray for rain, you got to deal with the mud too," he says to start off the video clip . a bold request for the team to invite him to the national championship game when it reaches it . it's a no-brainer the Giants should select him no. 3 overall .

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of 4 p.m. ET on monday . the 49ers are interested in Mac Jones, dating back to the 2021 draft .

title: Power Rankings: Knicks slip while the Warriors climb
content: the end of the regular season is a month away and one team has already clinched a playoff spot with several more on the brink . this week's Power Rankings takes stock of each team's health and how each should approach the final weeks of the season .

title: Wisconsin looks to cap one of the best seasons ever with a national title
content: team USA delivered the "Miracle on Ice," stunning the Soviet squad in the semifinals . "it always puts a smile on your face," says coach mark Johnson . 67-year-old is a lifetime removed from the Miracle .

title: What will be India's approach to trade talks with US?
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: More Humiliation For Pak Cricketers: All 50 Go Unsold In The Hundred Draft
content: all 50 players - 45 men and 5 women - went unsold in The Hundred draft . Naseem Shah was the highest-priced among them . noor Ahmad and new Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell got the best deals .
